content.label: Now I have to pay another 4.99? I tried to restore but failed

This game is a classic. It’s one my favorites from the Xbox 360 days (Xbox Love Arcade) and one of my favorite mobile game’s It looks and sounds as beautiful as the console version The touch controls take some getting used to but they work really well A controller works better but needs a little more refinement The controller won’t work on menus It’d be nice to re-map the buttons Also I would like for touch screen buttons to be removed from the screen while using controller but none of these issues are game breaking The controller works well for gameplay Also I would like to SuperGiant on how handled their business of offering the game free so that owners of previous version wouldn’t feel screwed over Get this game You won’t be disappointed Also pick Transistor Another incredible premium experience

This game is one of the coolest games in the App Store! It's too bad other developers don't make games this way. The graphics are gorgeous, the background music is awesome, game play is great, and the story is great. I am really enjoying Bastion.

title.label: Just started but pretty awesome game so far

content.label:
So far I really like this game. Best part is none of the crap free games do with trying to get you to put up $10, $25, $50!!!! just to be able to advance at a reasonable pace. Try it out for a little while for free then decide if you want to pay which you will of course and they know it because it’s awesome!!!!!

As far as the game goes good story line so far. Makes you really want to keep playing to find out what happened and how many more people are out there. Game play is pretty easy you don’t have to worry about getting killed constantly unlike games like last day on earth which I liked for a while until it became impossible to get to where you needed to go without spending money and or buying weapons. This game you can play as long as you want with none of that waiting 20 min for a charge to appear. So many games could be great if they would just offer a paid ver.

Other aspects I like. This may seem odd but the sound track is really cool. It reminds me exactly of the firefly tv show. Still one of the greatest shows ever made! The way each land area forms as you go is pretty neat graphically and the of course the narration of the story is perfect. Lots of funny little jokes added in if you decide to stupidly run off the side and die or go hack and slash on the fence posts.

Definitely worth a try.

name.label: C R O N U S T I T A N

content.label:
I bought this game since the beginning..

And now you want me to pay for it again???!! 

Why?! This is bad:(

I have a iPhone 11 Pro Max, and the game looks blurry. I know it’s a port but the poor resolution is hard to look past. The controls are clunky and unreliable. The game seems fun but difficult to play with such unforgivable controls and visuals. Maybe will revisit later if/when these issues are addressed

title.label: One of the best iOS games

content.label: Well done I’d like another like it please.

I just finished playing through for the first time. Excellent story, narration and soundtrack. Game options kept me entertained and I never felt like I was grinding for loot or just killing time. I WILL be playing this again and again. Well worth the cost to play. Oh and even better that you just pay ONCE for the game and don’t have to deal with in-app purchases etc. it’s a game like games used to be.
Cool game. Glad I bought it. No micro transactions!!! Yay!!

title.label: By far the best mobile game I've ever played

content.label: Only complaint: everything feels so small and far away compared to the PC version
Please make a SQL👏

The game itself is as amazing as it ever was but needs a lot of work when it comes to controller support. You can use one sometimes but many actions will require you to put the controller down and touch the screen. There's also no way to remap buttons or a map to see how the controls are mapped in the first place.
This crashes as soon as I open it on my iPad Air running iOS 9.3.5. Please fix so I can experience this much loved game.

title.label: Beautiful gameplay with a riveting narrative

content.label:
The narration is beautiful in and of itself, and the gameplay is just as challenging or satisfyingly easy as you'd like it to be.

There are not only new functional features to uncover as you play through, but the new weapons and features all have rich stories that come along with them.
Very atmospheric storytelling. Great music. Above average action. Overall best mobile game I have played!

Playing this on a mobile device has its learning curve, but it doesn’t detract from the enjoyment of playing this classic. It’s been great to play this out and about, and the music has not diminished whatsoever.

title.label: Great on iPhone, not on iPad mini

content.label: Very engrossing gameplay, with perfect blend of action and absorbing story. Beautiful graphics, music, and expert voiceover that adds to gameplay. One star off though for not running on 1st gen iPad mini; would prefer running on mini over iPhone because of poor eyesight. UPDATE: Went into my past purchases and downloaded the previous version distributed by Warner Bros., which runs fine on my 1st gen iPad mini. Curious why the new version doesn't.

Just downloaded recently and played a bit. Looks like it doesn't auto-save constantly, and there doesn't seem to be a manual save option, which it weird. When I logged back in a second time it had not saved all of my progress. That will get tiring really soon if it continues to be a thing.

This is an excellent game, and thanks for the giveaway! You’re a great team. 

That said, the performance has been terrible on both my iPhone 11 and latest iPad Mini. Constant stuttering. I don’t think the prior version was this way, so please address so everyone can enjoy this awesome game!
It’s amazing, it’s a free adventure game with an awesome storytelling. If your a fan of hack n slash, you should play this game

I love this game (now replaying this updated version), but seriously wish it had better controller support; the instructions on-screen are only suited for touch controls—so you have to figured out which button does what action—and the contextual menu is not controller-compatible AT ALL.

Please, make these adjustments... and, it would’ve been nice to have tv support to make this app truly universal.
Usually not my style of game but this is very well done and enjoyable. Was a nice surprise to get it all free as well. These devs rock!!!
I have this game on Steam along with over 500 others and this is one of my top 5.  The game has a great story, excellent sound track, and compelling gameplay.  Check it out.

title.label: DO NOT PASS ON THIS GAME

content.label:
This is honestly one of the best games of all time. The gameplay is great and you can basically set your own challenges as you progress through the story. There is an assortment of weapons to use as well as customizations to them to further suit your gameplay style. The world is beautiful and engaging as it literally builds around you. 

BUT

In my opinion, what makes this game so engaging is the very well voiced narration as it guides you through the game and story. Even more engrossing is the music by Darren Korb. I can not say enough to this man’s contribution to video game music. There are a few songs in game with sung lyrics by both Korb and vocalist Ashley Barrett. While Barrett’s voice is hauntingly beautiful in Bastion, I also want to strongly recommend you check out Supergiant’s game “Transistor” where she shines through the game’s soundtrack, amazingly written and produced by Korb. 

Honestly, any game by Supergiant Games is a literal journey into a fantastical world and has none have ever disappointed me. If Bastion is your first experience by this developer, you’re in for a wild ride!

title.label: 👏m e m e👏r e v i e w

content.label: literally the best game on the App Store. why pay for  a game when Bastion is the best game on the App Store by far.
Has a great balance between combat and story, also I can tell that a great deal of effort went into making this game, good job.
Haven’t played a RPG with this story telling ability in years, let alone not on a console.  This game is WORTH it!

Bastion is one of the best mobile games out there that actually tells a great story behind its amazing visual art style. Besides the one time purchase to unlock the rest of the game, it doesn’t try to force feed you microtransactions or other pay to win garbage that litters most other mobile games out there. If you enjoyed playing the free portion of the game, definitely get the rest of the game. It’s worth it.

Just started the game after reading a news article on the game, I’m impressed to say the least.
Love the voice of the narrator, it sort of fits the game and help set the tone of it.
I love this game but it looks blurry on my iPhone 11

I own Bastion on Mac, iOS and PS4! I love it. One of my top 10 games all time.

This version is a bit laggy (even on 2018 iPad Pro).I hope they fix this.

Great game with great music and great gameplay. Narrator has a great voice and helps the story. He really helps world building. Gameplay is fun with variety of weapons and enemies. You can choose 2 weapons of your choice as you go out into the world ruined world to find pieces that will help rebuild. There are also skills and perks you can choose before you go out. Spent many hours playing this game. Highly recommend
as understood by cs go and now this, soon all paid games will be freeee :>

I’m trying to play on iOS 13 with an Xbox controller and finding it difficult - there’s an onscreen button to initiate my hammer spin, but I have found no corresponding gamepad button. It also feels strange to have B attack with current weapon and Y toggle between two weapons instead of having B attack melee and Y attack ranged.
The story telling makes easy to understand the only problem is that it might be too dark and since the floor seems to be appearing. It just makes it really hard to see it.

No microtransactions or internet connection requirements, this game makes every effort to be a faithful replica of the PC version, with a few changes to be mobile-friendly. 

The controls are slightly dumbed down - in a good way. There’s the classic control scheme which offers a gamepad (console-style) UI. The other option is a smart control scheme truly designed for mobile from the ground-up: Click to move, auto-aim and attack, and a few other buttons. I like how the smart control scheme largely prevents falling through holes in the ground which can be extremely common. 

The gamepad (classic) UI made the smart decision of having auto-targeting instead of twin-stick gameplay which would be downright cumbersome. 

My only gripe with the simplified UI is that it doesn’t show ammo meters for ranged weapons, which means you could jump into combat and get a nasty surprise when your opening move is “reload”. Other than that - well done, extremely well done. 

Difficulty is generally lower than on PC - understandable due to control limitations. Falling through holes in the ground doesn’t damage you, enemies do lower damage, and health restores are more common, although you can’t stockpile health restores like on PC. In case you’re absolutely terrible at video games, there’s an “infinite lives” mode so you can cheat your way through and enjoy the story without any semblance of difficulty. 

That’s just about all the differences. For those who are new to Bastion, it’s the first (and IMO) best ever game from Supergiant. It’s best thought of as a 2D action-adventure with innovative storyline, great music, and combat just complex enough for a PC game - which translates into something far above the mobile games industry.

Bear in mind that Bastion is not a loot ARPG, despite using similar combat style and visual presentation. Items and upgrades are not randomly generated with affixes (although you can find upgrades with fixed, predetermined stats). 

In case you haven’t figured it out, Bastion easily gets 5 stars.

title.label: Great game but the iPhone port could be better

content.label: I’ve been meaning to play this for ages and had the old iOS and steam copy. Downloaded again to get the free updated on. I think a zoom option would be nice. On my iPhone 11 Pro Max it’s so zoomed out the main character is very small and hard to see and so is the text.

title.label: Amazing game, will throughly enjoy it.

content.label: Amazing visuals and amazing sound design. A game that pulls you in to its world and you just can’t stop playing it. Highly recommend you give it a try.

title.label: Bastion is one of my all time favorites

content.label: Played this game on pc when it first came out and have been scared to come back to it because I was worried it wouldn’t live up to my nostalgia. This version lives up to and exceeds those expectations. Love every moment of this must play game.

I love this game; and this port is fantastic. However, you cannot menu with the controller like you can in Transistor, nor can you alter controls in-game. Moreover, if you play with a controller the on-screen controls stay visible. Kinda defeats the purpose if you ask me.

Bastion is a treat for the senses. Everyone should have this game on some device. But I’m really hoping they improve controller support. Oh, and vibration only functions on the phone. I’ve heard developers can change that; but I haven’t played a single game that proves this.
